sentence.idiomatic: This temple looks so magnificent and holy.
The Olympic torch bearers have undertaken a sacred mission.
Every country's territory is sacred ground; it cannot be violated.
China has 5,000 years of history.
We must carry on and continue on in our long-time cultural traditions.
I like to look at those kinds of historical monuments.
Everyone in this class is a high achiever; if you don't work hard you won't make it.
Go and ask him, he is a total computer ace.
Our modern society has many masters in their fields; could the competition not be fierce?
This shop has been around for a long time, their stuff is pretty good.
Some long-standing famous brand shoe stores in Shanghai have very good quality shoes--just not very stylish.
In the end it was the old favorite team that won the football game again this time.
Your house is decorated very yuppie-style. The furniture all has that Northern European look.
Young people after the 1980s all seem to have a bit of a yuppie way about them. As soon as they get a little money they develop their own individual style.
When he first came to Shanghai he was still a bit of a hick. Now he is so yuppie-like!
I want to learn a second language. Which language is in demand these days?
This major is really hot--the past few years the grade cut-off point has been really high.
Employment, job-hopping, and salary are all hot issues.
Right now stocks are soaring; who knows on which day they will plummet.
Let's eat first, who knows when he will get back.
You must have faith, you quite possibly could be the champion.
Taking such a unpopular major--there really is no future in it.
There isn't a lot of demand for his business, but the more he does it, the bigger it gets.
Now that the transportation is convenient, what were originally very unpopular destinations have now become hot tourist spots.
These two teams are equally matched, it's difficult to say who will win and who will lose.
One of them has been in China a long time, the other a short time, yet their Chinese level is almost the same.
From an economic standpoint, these two cities are more or less the same, you could go to either.
There are a lot of awesome people in our company. We can learn a lot from them.
Are you taking it too far? You have quite the guts to argue like that with the boss.
On the exterior he seems really amazing, but at home he is totally henpecked by his wife.
The accident has already happened, blaming others is of no use.
He is already married, crying to no end is of no use.
The computer has a virus, I restarted it a few times but it was useless.
What is your plan for university?
Either Beijing University or Fudan University. I haven't decided yet. My mom hopes I go to Shanghai, and my dad wants me to attend Beijing University.
Beijing University has a better reputation. Don't they say that Beijing University is the Harvard of China, while Fudan is the Yale?
Beijing University is so revered, and has such a long history. Everyone there is so top notch--I'm in awe of them.
Fudan is also a renowned school. Hey, they say a long time ago two of Fudan's school presidents were Yale graduates.
Really? According to our Liberal Arts department, I should try to get into Beijing University or Fudan.
Wow! We are not in the same league!

The school atmosphere at both universities is very good, with both encouraging independent thought from their students. Beijing University, however, seems to have a bit more of a political atmosphere; while Fudan is a little more liberal and yuppie.
The reason for that is their locations. Beijing University is at the foot the central government, and Fudan... it's in Shanghai.
Way beyond the reaches of the authorities, where economics take priority.
All right, let's not just talk about what we think, what major are you considering?
The finance, management side of things. These fields are in great demand. My parents say that in the times of peace, you can make a lot of money in economics.
There's no guarantees what's hot now will be in demand when we graduate!
I'm also quite interested in journalism and broadcasting.
In regards to finance, Beijing University and Fudan are about the same. Journalism is a bit better at Fudan. But the GPA requirements are higher for Beijing University.
Hmm. We had better get reviewing. If we don't do well on the exams, all of this will be useless.
You should have no problem.
